allTitles: {"en":"About Coronavirus","es":"Sobre el Coronavirus","id":"Anamanae rerihoni Virus Corona"}

2.nxl: Diterjemahkan oleh: Huna Matoke dan Rosemary Bolton

4.eng: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
4.nxl: Kahurae ianei rerihoni sapani na virus corana

12.nxl: Virus renae sani apana na oko tin-tinia rapeu

13.eng: Keep your distance.﻿2m will keep you safe from large droplets.
13.nxl: na isaka ruata arihoni sae waron rapeu

17.eng: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
17.nxl: Reiso sani anoo ia isa wain iakihuha te iasinara te ikupui, mo, kahuraesaka na:

18.eng: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby.
18.nxl: Rui nipa sinte wani renete hohari na okori (masker). Na oakihuha te iasinara renete hohai na renete ia sia man wain ihainekei.

20.nxl: Uainisi iake arihonia ano wani asinara

22.eng: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself
22.nxl: Kani ikupu tewa, ne hasae nani inete ruai.

23.eng: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
23.nxl: Ia waini isupu virus rei nea mo, inoo tewa ata wain ikupui. Ne masike san rei bisa renae sinia.

24.eng: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
24.nxl: Nene iake mo, hainau arihon mansia hutue. Tau ianei tewa ata ia sia sahoro ikupui.

25.nxl: Sondo te sae wani ipakei tau iai

28.nxl: Tampa iese na ihuka mitanunue na ihukai

32.eng: & even on the outside of your face mask
32.nxl: Nipa sinte wani ipakei na renete hohari okori rei nene muie.

38.eng: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
38.nxl: Masike sapan iae sio kupua no tunna mo, bisa rakina tau apia san;

40.nxl: Te oakahuu ia isa wain anom runai uai anoe.

42.eng: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
42.nxl: Na sani anei tewa ne akahuu apia waron sinasi rei, oyo akahuu uam anoe.

43.eng: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
43.nxl: Onina na virus rei tihoniki mo, kahurae osohu apia rai tau saponi, bayklin, te alkohol.

44.eng: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
44.nxl: Virus bisa reruei noi apia rai yam nimasa te wanusa san rei.

46.nxl: arenau waron rakahaita na inete iroha virus rei. Sani rei;

47.eng: Which is why it is also good to follow these

48.eng: wash with soap up to here
48.nxl: Sohu tau sapon rotu kua rei.

51.eng: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
51.nxl: Pene akahuu uam anoe. Te ia sia man uai anoe. Ne nesi na akahuui sirinia mo, kahurae asohu hanam atua tau sapon ia-ia ee.

52.eng: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
52.nxl: Noo sani iahina ahina selamat ulang tahun nai ua.

56.eng: wash the back of your hands

57.nxl: Sohu hanari wani iake na kitataya tewa mo, sapan?

58.eng: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
58.nxl: Sani oakahui nea mo, rapu sohu hanamo tau saponi.

59.eng: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.
59.nxl: Pene akahu nipa sinte te masker rei nene muie.

61.eng: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
61.nxl: Kupue inae bisa remahaiki pani nipae sinte te masker rei anoe sani ipakei potuina.

62.eng: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
62.nxl: Pesi te papa nipa sinte (masker) wani ipakei renete hohari na okori sani iahana ikitataie nea. Pene pake nipa sinte te masker rei rotu ranie hatae.

63.nxl: Pake sondo tau ketu utane te ana.

68.eng: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
68.nxl: Pene sama muaine, pirune, kalasi, sondo te mamkusa hana.

69.eng: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
69.nxl: Bisa oakahu ruamo uamo anomo tau siumo tewa. Sani bisa mo, rea mana tea.

70.eng: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
70.nxl: Huka na raru mitanunue tau siuri te saniri sani bisa una sani rei.

72.eng: and after being out in the public
72.nxl: Onuni on noi mui wani mansia hutue.

74.eng: Always wash your hands with soap…
74.nxl: Sohu hanam tau saponi sui osa.

80.eng: Read the articles for more tips!
80.nxl: Baca tau nomor 1, 2 na 3 na oanei panesi honu rerihoni virus corona

81.eng: "This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)

82.eng: "The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)

83.eng: "How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020

85.eng:
Additional notes:  Hygiene precautions in comic are effective in preventing many other common infections such as flu and cold, and should be applied in every day life, even when there is no epidemic. 
References:  lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references. ﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/ ﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Additonal lnformation  A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here:﻿﻿https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Sharing Guidelines  This comic is free for the general public to share online and through Whatsapp and Telegram, and the downloads are free for printing out as posters for personal and educational use in homes, schools, and workplaces. 
When sharing, please remember these 3 points: ﻿1) No edits to the comics is allowed in any way when sharing.﻿2) Comics cannot be used for any commercial project﻿3) lf online, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow
﻿For all other uses, please send a request in to: comicsforgood@gmail.com

90.ind: Created by Weiman Kow, instagram: weimankow

bookText.eng:
About Coronavirus



There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
SPREADS
Mouth
Nose
Eyes
Get into your
Healthy Person
Sick Person
The virus spreads when ﻿these droplets
Keep your distance.﻿2m will keep you safe from large droplets.
1
2m
Achoo!
So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby.
2
Thank you﻿*sniffles*
OR,
Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself
People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
Chopsticks
Healthy person
Train straps
Lift buttons
Tissues
Cups
Digital devices
& even on the outside of your face mask
Stair bannisters
Mouse
Pens
Door knobs
Their hands
However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
you might all fall sick.
or your loved one's face
rub eyes
And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
soap
precautions
Which is why it is also good to follow these
wash with soap up to here
soap
elbow
Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
under the nails
for 20 seconds
between the fingers
wash the back of your hands
What is thoroughly?
If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.
droplets
*Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
Use a serving spoon
Baby
Daddy
Mommy
Everyone gets their own towel
Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
Home
and after being out in the public
Before you eat
Always wash your hands with soap…
And finally,
soap
Stay safe, everyone!
Stay safe, everyone!
soap
Read the articles for more tips!
"This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)
"The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)
"How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020

bookText.nxl:
Diterjemahkan oleh: Huna Matoke dan Rosemary Bolton

Kahurae ianei rerihoni sapani na virus corana
RENAE
Hohari
Okori
Matari
Renusu na pani
Ia wain ikupu tewa
Ia kupue
Virus renae sani apana na oko tin-tinia rapeu
 na isaka ruata arihoni sae waron rapeu

Meter 2-0,5
Haaach!!!
Reiso sani anoo ia isa wain iakihuha te iasinara te ikupui, mo, kahuraesaka na:
Rui nipa sinte wani renete hohari na okori (masker). Na oakihuha te iasinara renete hohai na renete ia sia man wain ihainekei.

Uainisi iake arihonia ano wani asinara

Kani ikupu tewa, ne hasae nani inete ruai.
Ia waini isupu virus rei nea mo, inoo tewa ata wain ikupui. Ne masike san rei bisa renae sinia.
Nene iake mo, hainau arihon mansia hutue. Tau ianei tewa ata ia sia sahoro ikupui.
Sondo te sae wani ipakei tau iai
Ia waini ne patane maka-makae
Mamrime noi kereta api
Tampa iese na ihuka mitanunue na ihukai
Tisu
Koinanae
Sani Hp te komputer
Nipa sinte wani ipakei na renete hohari okori rei nene muie.
Oane nene mamrime
Maisene tau komputer
Pena te pensil
Mitanunue nene hanae
Hanao atua
Masike sapan iae sio kupua no tunna mo, bisa rakina tau apia san;
Pusimo bisa okupumo.
Te oakahuu ia isa wain anom runai uai anoe.
Oasioi matamo usena
Na sani anei tewa ne akahuu apia waron sinasi rei, oyo akahuu uam anoe.
Onina na virus rei tihoniki mo, kahurae osohu apia rai tau saponi, bayklin, te alkohol.
Virus bisa reruei noi apia rai yam nimasa te wanusa san rei.
Saponi
arenau waron rakahaita na inete iroha virus rei. Sani rei;
Areiso nene iake mo, opusu
Sohu tau sapon rotu kua rei.
Sapon
kua siuri
Pene akahuu uam anoe. Te ia sia man uai anoe. Ne nesi na akahuui sirinia mo, kahurae asohu hanam atua tau sapon ia-ia ee.
Noo sani iahina ahina selamat ulang tahun nai ua.
Tanikure aikuna
Potuina kani 20 detik
Hanari nakata tihua
Sohu hanari hahaya
Sohu hanari wani iake na kitataya tewa mo, sapan?
Sani oakahui nea mo, rapu sohu hanamo tau saponi.
Pene akahu nipa sinte te masker rei nene muie.
reroti
Kupue inae bisa remahaiki pani nipae sinte te masker rei anoe sani ipakei potuina.
Pesi te papa nipa sinte (masker) wani ipakei renete hohari na okori sani iahana ikitataie nea. Pene pake nipa sinte te masker rei rotu ranie hatae.
Pake sondo tau ketu utane te ana.
Ia ikine.
Ama
Ina
Pake mamkusa hana sakakau
Pene sama muaine, pirune, kalasi, sondo te mamkusa hana.
Bisa oakahu ruamo uamo anomo tau siumo tewa. Sani bisa mo, rea mana tea.
Huka na raru mitanunue tau siuri te saniri sani bisa una sani rei.
Numa
Onuni on noi mui wani mansia hutue.

Sohu hanam tau saponi sui osa.
Tau muie
Saponi
Saka na mo patana maka-makaya
Saka na iamahaita iake.
Saponi
Baca tau nomor 1, 2 na 3 na oanei panesi honu rerihoni virus corona
